meanings.definition: Relating to or involving an autopsy.
meanings.sent1: The doctor conducted an autopsic examination to determine the cause of death.
meanings.sent2: The autopsic report revealed the exact details of the deceased person's injuries.
meanings.sent3: During the autopsic investigation, the detective found a surprising clue in the victim's pocket.
meanings.sent4: Her autopsic attention to detail in the crime scene analysis helped solve the mysterious case.
meanings.sent5: The autopsic procedure provided crucial evidence for the forensic team.

meanings.definition: A detailed examination or analysis of something after it has occurred.
meanings.sent1: The scientist performed an autopsic on the data to uncover hidden patterns.
meanings.sent2: After the project failed, they conducted an autopsic to understand what went wrong.
meanings.sent3: The autopsic of the failed experiment revealed a critical flaw in the methodology.
meanings.sent4: His autopsic of the financial records exposed a major discrepancy in the accounts.
meanings.sent5: The autopsic of the ancient artifact provided valuable insights into its history.
